Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description


About Devoteam:

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals.

Our longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services. We complement these partnerships with in-depth Cyber, Data & AI, Software development and multi cloud expertise. 

For 30 years, we have always been guiding our customers on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.

With 11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe

At Devoteam, tech is in our DNA, and it’s the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we’re ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.


Job Description


If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications


For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels. 

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information


#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
  3. Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.

  5. Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
  6. Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.

Title: Analyste de données
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.




SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis




Qualifications:

You hold a master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.




We offer:

A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group




If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium. Let's Tech Together!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Vacature: Data Analist (Freelancer)




Voor een langdurig project bij onze klant in Antwerpen (2 dagen onsite) zoeken wij een ervaren Data Analist die een sleutelrol speelt in het vertalen van businessbehoeften naar functionele en technische oplossingen. Deze rol biedt de mogelijkheid om op locatie te werken, vlakbij het station van Antwerpen, met de extra optie van parkeergelegenheid aangeboden door Cegeka.




Verantwoordelijkheden:




🔍 Business Analyse:

Verzamelen, challengen en documenteren van de behoeften van eindgebruikers.
Vertalen van business requirements naar functionele vereisten en het beheren van de requirements gedurende het project.
Begrijpen van de bedrijfsprocessen en gebruik van applicaties om werkbare oplossingen te ontwikkelen.
Impactanalyse uitvoeren en nauw samenwerken met de Product Owner en het team om de klantuitdagingen te begrijpen.
Bewaken van de eind-tot-eind (E2E) oplossing voor een optimale businessimpact.




💡 Oplossingsvoorstel:

Analyseren van klantbehoeften en het voorstellen van de beste mogelijke oplossing.
Evalueren van IT-voordelen en kosten van voorgestelde oplossingen (bijv. licentiekosten, effort).
Organiseren van workshops en presentaties om de oplossing met de business te valideren.
Toepassen van richtlijnen en standaarden om de oplossing te waarborgen en te testen.




📊 Functionele Analyse:

Opstellen van een gedetailleerde functionele analyse volgens de afgesproken standaarden.
Het waarborgen van de functionele architectuur van applicaties (bijv. datamodel).
Beheren van de applicatie-informatie en definiëren van de autorisatiematrix in samenwerking met andere teams.




📑 Functioneel Design:

Ontwikkelen van functionele designs en interfacespecificaties.
Vastleggen van rollen en verantwoordelijkheden binnen het applicatielandschap.




📚 Documentatie:

Opstellen en onderhouden van documentatie over de gekozen oplossingen en processen.




🧑‍🏫 Kennisontwikkeling:

Actief deelnemen aan teamwerking en collega’s ondersteunen.
Bijdragen aan de eigen ontwikkeling en professionalisering, en die van het team.




✅ Kwaliteitsbewaking:

Faciliteren van acceptatietesten en het creëren van bewustwording rond kwaliteit.
Testplannen reviewen en gebruikersacceptatietests opvolgen.




🔧 Continuous Improvement:

Identificeren en uitvoeren van verbeteracties om processen te optimaliseren en de kwaliteit van het product of de dienst te verbeteren.
Automatiseren van testscenario's en het up-to-date houden van systeemdocumentatie.




🤝 Zelforganiserende Teams:

Deelnemen aan Agile ceremonies zoals dagelijkse scrums en PI planning.
Actief bijdragen aan de teamperformance door feedback te geven en ontvangen.




⚠️ Risico's Beheren:

Signaleren van risico’s en het naleven van het security- en risicobeheerbeleid.




Profiel:

Ervaring: Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Business of Functioneel Analist, bij voorkeur met een sterke focus op data en ETL-processen.
Technische Vaardigheden: Ervaring met 3NF, Data Vault, Stermodel ontwikkeling en SQL.
Communicatieve Vaardigheden: Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels.
Onafhankelijk Werken: In staat om het eigen werk te organiseren en collega’s te coachen.
Probleemoplossend: Proactief in het identificeren van oplossingen en risico’s.
Agile Mindset: Ervaring met Agile/Lean principes is een plus.




Wat bieden wij?

Een langdurig project bij een toonaangevende klant in Antwerpen.
Flexibiliteit om te werken in een dynamische en uitdagende werkomgeving, vlakbij het station.
Parkeergelegenheid kan verzorgd worden door Cegeka.
Aantrekkelijke voorwaarden en ruimte voor professionele groei.

Show more

Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -  September 2025
Description:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.



Your profile

We Are Looking For Someone Who


Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Is eligible for security clearance.



Success In This Role Often Comes Down To


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.



Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.



Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Title: Data Analyst Reporting Automotive
Description:
Fonction




En tant que Data Analyst, vous avez, au sein du département Reporting Automotive, la charge de comparer des données (Clients, Compagnies, Internes), d’analyser et interpréter les résultats afin d’établir des rapports personnalisés pour nos clients ou partenaires. Vous jouez un rôle clé car vous serez garant de la qualité des données et serez souvent amené à travailler avec plusieurs équipes (Sinistres, IT, Production, Clients Manager, Comptabilité)




Vos tâches sont diversifiées:




Vous créez, administrez et modélisez les rapports et vous vous assurez de livrer les données nécessaires selon les deadlines fixées.
Vous avez la charge du traitement, de l’exploitation des données dans notre système interne.
Vous traitez des données provenant de systèmes partenaires (Ubench, Fixico)
Vous aidez à la mise en place des nouveaux process et vous assurez le maintien à jour des process existants
Vous utilisez ou gérez le planning de l’équipe
Vous assurez la livraison des différents jobs opérationnels




Profil




Vous avez obtenu un Bachelier (ou équivalent par expérience).
Vous avez de préférence une première expérience en assurance Automobile.
Vous parlez couramment le français et avez une bonne maitrise du néerlandais. L’anglais est un atout.
Vous maitrisez bien la suite Office et en particulier Excel (Niveau avancé).
Vous connaissez et pouvez utiliser les outils « Power Tools ».
Vous avez un esprit analytique, vous êtes à l'aise avec les chiffres et le traitement des données.
Vous pouvez travailler seul ou en équipe.
Vous êtes organisé(e) et avez une bonne gestion des priorités.




Intéressé(e) ?




Voulez-vous en savoir plus sur Aon et ce poste ? Postulez chez le leader du marché pour un emploi dynamique avec des opportunités d'apprentissage et de croissance ainsi qu'un package salarial compétitif.




-----




Functie




Als Data Analyst binnen de afdeling Reporting Automotive ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergelijken van gegevens (klanten, bedrijven, intern), het analyseren en interpreteren van de resultaten om gepersonaliseerde rapporten op te stellen voor onze klanten of partners. Je speelt een sleutelrol omdat je verantwoordelijk bent voor de kwaliteit van de gegevens en vaak zal samenwerken met verschillende teams (Claims, IT, Productie, Client Manager, Boekhouding).




Je taken zijn gevarieerd:




Je maakt, beheert en modelleert rapporten en zorgt ervoor dat de benodigde gegevens volgens de vastgestelde deadlines worden geleverd.
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de verwerking en exploitatie van gegevens in ons interne systeem.
Je verwerkt gegevens afkomstig van partnersystemen (Ubench, Fixico).
Je helpt bij het implementeren van nieuwe processen en zorgt voor het up-to-date houden van bestaande processen.
Je gebruikt of beheert de planning van het team.
Je zorgt voor de levering van verschillende operationele taken.




Profiel




Je hebt een Bachelor diploma (of gelijkwaardig door ervaring).
Je hebt idealiter een eerste ervaring in autoverzekeringen.
Je spreekt vloeiend Frans of Nederlands en hebt een goede beheersing van de tweede taal. Engels is een pluspunt.
Je beheerst de Office-suite goed, vooral Excel (gevorderd niveau).
Je kent en kunt de "Power Tools" gebruiken.
Je hebt een analytische geest, bent goed met cijfers en gegevensverwerking.
Je kan zelfstandig of in teamverband werken.
Je bent georganiseerd en je kan goed je prioriteiten stellen.




Interesse?




Wil je meer weten over Aon en deze vacature? Solliciteer bij de marktleider naar een dynamische baan met leer-en groeimogelijkheden en een competitief salarispakket.







2559877

  • Je hebt een analytische geest, bent goed met cijfers en gegevensverwerking.

Wil je meer weten over Aon en deze vacature? Solliciteer bij de marktleider naar een dynamische baan met leer-en groeimogelijkheden en een competitief salarispakket.

Title: The Wave recrute un(e) Data Analyst !
Description:
The Wave est une entreprise belge spécialisée dans le Lead et le Data Marketing.

Dans un monde où la data évolue en permanence, nous avons imaginé et lancé en 2023 une plateforme de Marketing Data & IA en mode SaaS, pensée pour répondre aux nouveaux enjeux des annonceurs.


Notre mission :
Injecter une data consommateur de qualité dans toutes les actions marketing afin d’améliorer considérablement leur précision, leur pertinence et leur ROI.
Automatiser les processus opérationnels grâce à l’intelligence artificielle, pour permettre aux équipes marketing de se concentrer sur ce qui compte vraiment : la stratégie, la créativité et l'innovation.
Mesurer l’impact incrémental des campagnes de communication avec une fiabilité et une granularité exceptionnelles, pour piloter les performances des marques avec précision.

Notre ambition est claire : optimiser les investissements marketing en s’appuyant sur une base de données intelligente, riche et 100 % conforme aux exigences du RGPD.

En pleine croissance, nous recherchons un·e Data Analyst passionné·e pour rejoindre notre équipe et transformer la donnée en levier stratégique.

 

Ce que tu feras chez The Wave :
Collecter, nettoyer et structurer des jeux de données complexes pour les rendre exploitables.
Réaliser des analyses statistiques poussées et créer des visualisations claires à l’aide d’outils comme Grafana, Tableau ou Power BI.
Développer des scripts en Python, PHP (Laravel) et SQL pour automatiser les tâches et optimiser les flux de données.
Participer à la création d’API et collaborer étroitement avec les équipes métiers pour répondre à leurs besoins.
Contribuer à la documentation technique, assurer une veille technologique active et proposer des pistes d’amélioration continue.




Ton profil :
Tu maîtrises Python, PHP (Laravel) et SQL/MySQL/DuckDB.
Tu es à l’aise avec des outils comme Excel, MySQL Workbench et Airflow (Mage AI).
Tu fais preuve de rigueur, de curiosité, et tu sais structurer ton travail.
Tu as un bon sens de la synthèse et tu es capable de vulgariser des analyses complexes.
Tu es autonome, à l’écoute, et tu apprécies le travail en équipe.
Tu as d’excellentes capacités de communication, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit.




Pourquoi rejoindre The Wave ?

Intégrer The Wave, c’est rejoindre une entreprise innovante qui place la donnée et l’intelligence artificielle au cœur de sa stratégie, au service des plus grandes marques.

C’est aussi l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets concrets à fort impact, dans un environnement stimulant, bienveillant et en pleine croissance.

Prêt·e à relever le défi ? On a hâte de te rencontrer.




Show more

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
Who are we?

CFE is a multidisciplinary group (listed on Euronext Brussels) active in Belgium, Luxembourg and Poland in 4 businesses segments with high growth potential because they have the opportunity to shape the world of tomorrow:

Real Estate Development
Multitechnical
Construction & Renovation
Sustainable Investments

With more than 3100 employees and a long experience and expertise acquired since its foundation in 1880, the CFE Group aims to challenge the status quo and create positive change by successfully addressing environmental and social challenges for the well-being of future generations. The CFE Group achieves this ambition by placing sustainability, innovation and respect for employees at the heart of its strategy and by offering its customers end-to-end solutions.




Your Role & Responsabilities

Promote and integrate dashboards: Take an active role in the promotion, definition, and introduction of various dashboards to make data a strategic part of the organization's activities.
Create and maintain dashboards: Use your technical expertise to design and maintain dashboards based on data from different sources.
Translate business needs: Collaborate with business partners to define and translate their requirements into user-friendly dashboards and reports.
Coordinate with stakeholders: Guide internal and external partners in developing necessary interfaces, extractors, and reports.
Dashboard governance: Establish reporting governance to ensure dashboards are consistent in design, methodology, and use a "single version of the truth."
Train and support users: Empower key users with training and support to help them become self-sufficient in creating and maintaining dashboards and reports.
Lead projects and initiatives: Oversee projects, initiatives, and tasks related to reporting, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
Documentation and reporting: Keep functional and technical documentation up-to-date and report regularly on project progress to stakeholders.
Risk management: Identify and proactively escalate issues, risks, and concerns when necessary.
Standardization and optimization: Stay informed about industry best practices and propose functional improvements and standardizations.
Manage external consultants: Supervise external consultants assigned to your projects, initiatives, and tasks.
Provide technical assistance: Offer support to end users when required, while promoting standard application setups.




Your Profile

You hold a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
You have at least 5 years of experience in reporting and dashboarding, as well as 3 years of project management experience in a complex organization.
You are an expert in Power BI, with solid expertise in Power Automate, Power Apps, MS SQL, MS SharePoint, and MS Dataverse, along with knowledge of ETL processes. Familiarity with tools such as Tableau, Qlik Sense, IBM Cognos, SAS BI, and Google Data is a plus.
You have high-level knowledge of industry best practices.
You are fluent in Dutch, French, and English, enabling seamless communication across diverse teams.
You demonstrate strong technical expertise in data modeling, ITIL frameworks, and technical design, with a focus on delivering actionable insights and impactful solutions.
You excel in problem-solving and analytical thinking, tackling challenges effectively while maintaining a strategic perspective.
You possess excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills, facilitating collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
You are proactive, accountable, and detail-oriented, with a focus on achieving results and driving productivity.
You thrive in a team environment while being able to work autonomously, encouraging collaboration and knowledge sharing.
You stay updated on emerging technological trends and demonstrate a passion for innovation and self-development.




What’s in it for you?

Come as You Are: At CFE, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. Our company culture embraces and celebrates individuality, fostering a workplace that is completely free from any form of harassment, bias, or discrimination. We encourage all qualified applicants, regardless of gender, to apply.




What We Offer: Besides great colleagues and a fantastic new wooden HQ in Brussels, you will be offered a competitive compensation & benefits package including:

A full-time position with the possibility of hybrid working and the ability to flex your hours as you need.
An attractive remuneration package with many advantages such as a competitive base pay, a range of extralegal benefits as: sustainable transport options (mobility budget or lease car), lunch vouchers, a pension savings scheme and affiliation at a hospitalization insurance plan.
Opportunities for professional growth and development in various areas.
A collaborative and supportive team culture.
A challenging and dynamic work environment.

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
Introduction

Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

About This Job

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.

Your profile

Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have


Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques – not just programmers.
Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation;
Excellent communication skills in English;
Ability to work independently and as part of a team;
Willingness to learn about new topics, methods, and skills.


The Following Will Be Considered As a Plus


Proficiency in other languages.


Your responsibilities

Typical Tasks May Include


Developing data analysis pipelines;
Applying supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to mainly text data;
Data wrangling;
Data visualisation;
Reporting results of analysis;
Assist in other tasks such as literature reviews, case studies and other tasks where needed.


Our offer

Skills

The successful candidate will work as a paid intern in our Brussels office. The role provides the opportunity to gain experience in working at the forefront of European policymaking, to develop analytical skills, and to experience a multinational, friendly business environment. Our package includes:


Paid internship
Belgian phone subscription
Monthly allowance for the transportation card
Training and mentoring possibilities
Working in an international company with 12 offices and more than 290 colleagues


Interested? Apply directly

Applicants need to have either EU citizenship or a valid work permit.

For any questions on the recruitment, please contact recruitment_be@technopolis-group.com (reference DSU_INT2025).

Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Apply for this job

About Us

Technopolis Group started as a consultancy firm for the evaluation of science, technology and innovation. While evaluation is still at the core of our company, we have over the years built up the know-how to support decision making on a broad range of topics. Our experts provide strategy and foresight, manage networks and provide project management support for even the most complex projects. We are acquainted with a wide range of quantitative methods and deliver advanced data analytics that is ahead of the curve. We evaluate policies, evaluate their impact and communicate them effectively to experts and the broader public. We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&D centres, network organisations such as business associations, clusters and incubators as well as governments.
Show more
HTML:
Introduction

Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

About This Job

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.

Your profile

Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have

  • Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
  • Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
  • Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
  • Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
  • Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques – not just programmers.
  • Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation;
  • Excellent communication skills in English;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team;
  • Willingness to learn about new topics, methods, and skills.

The Following Will Be Considered As a Plus

  • Proficiency in other languages.

Your responsibilities

Typical Tasks May Include

  • Developing data analysis pipelines;
  • Applying supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to mainly text data;
  • Data wrangling;
  • Data visualisation;
  • Reporting results of analysis;
  • Assist in other tasks such as literature reviews, case studies and other tasks where needed.

Our offer

Skills

The successful candidate will work as a paid intern in our Brussels office. The role provides the opportunity to gain experience in working at the forefront of European policymaking, to develop analytical skills, and to experience a multinational, friendly business environment. Our package includes:

  • Paid internship
  • Belgian phone subscription
  • Monthly allowance for the transportation card
  • Training and mentoring possibilities
  • Working in an international company with 12 offices and more than 290 colleagues

Interested? Apply directly

Applicants need to have either EU citizenship or a valid work permit.

For any questions on the recruitment, please contact recruitment_be@technopolis-group.com (reference DSU_INT2025).

Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Research & Data Intern
Company: Long Duration Energy Storage Council (LDES Council)
Description:
Research & Data Intern




About the LDES Council

The Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES) Council is a global non-profit organization with founding members and a Board made up of executives and business leaders from leading energy companies, technology providers, investors and end-users. The LDES Council advances the decarbonisation of our world through the acceleration of long duration energy storage by providing member-driven, fact-based guidance and research on the deployment of long-duration energy storage for society's benefit.

Launched on November 4, 2021 at COP26, the LDES Council is rapidly growing and has established itself as a catalyst in driving global dialogues on long duration storage by providing fact-based guidance and information drawn from members’ expertise.




We are now seeking a Research & Data Intern to support our work tracking LDES projects, analyzing industry trends, and contributing to key research initiatives.




Position: Research & Data Intern

Location: Remote (+/- 3 hours Central European Timezone)

Employment Type: Paid internship (Full-time, 6 months with a possibility to extend)

Role Overview

The Research & Data Intern will play a vital role in managing and updating the LDES Council’s global project tracker, supporting industry research, and contributing to the development of key Council publications. This internship is an exciting opportunity for an individual passionate about clean energy, data management, and technology research who is looking to gain hands-on experience in the industry.




Key Responsibilities

Project Tracker & Data Management

Maintain and update the global LDES project tracker, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
Organize and enter project data, identifying and filling gaps
Conduct research to track new projects, funding announcements, and technology deployments.
Work with external partners to innovate on developing a new format for the tracker.

Database & Research Support

Work with Excel, Google Sheets, and other database tools to manage energy storage project data.
Assist in data gathering, cleaning, and analysis for internal reports and publications.
Support research on energy storage technologies, policies, and industry trends.

Technology Lookbook & Content Creation

Assist in updating and formatting the LDES Technology Lookbook with clear, visually appealing content.
Support the development of research-based materials, including reports, presentations, and white papers.

Industry Research & Monitoring

Monitor and track new energy storage projects, policy developments, and market trends.
Summarize key findings for internal discussions, presentations, and external reports.
Compile industry insights from various sources to inform Council initiatives.

General Support & Learning Opportunities

Assist with outreach to industry stakeholders to gather project data and insights.
Support team projects related to energy storage research, data tracking, and member engagement.
Contribute ideas to improve research methodologies, workflows, and Council initiatives.
Gain exposure to industry leaders, emerging technologies, and key policy discussions, providing a valuable opportunity for learning and career development within the organization.




Ideal Skills & Qualifications

Comfortable working with data management and analysis tools (Excel, Google Sheets, or similar).
Strong research and analytical skills, with the ability to summarize complex information clearly.
Interest in energy, sustainability, and emerging technologies.
High attention to detail and ability to organize large datasets.
Willingness to learn, take initiative, and collaborate in a fast-paced environment.
Educational background or experience in energy, engineering, policy, or data analytics is a plus.




Don’t meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building an inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply.




Why Join the LDES Council?

· Full time, permanent, salaried, benefits-eligible, exempt status

· Remote, collaborative culture

· Healthcare provided by LDES Council for individual, including medical, dental, vision insurance; family insurance available

· 401k contribution with matching contributions (in the US)

· Flexible paid time off, including your birthday!

· Paid parental leave

· Technology stipend for home office

· Global travel opportunities

Application Process

Interested candidates should submit:

A current CV (max 2 pages)
A short letter outlining your motivation and how you meet the requirements for the role




Please email your application to careers@ldescouncil.com using the subject line: “Recruiting: Research & Data Intern."

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LE TRAVAIL

En tant que Data Analyst/Steward, tu fais partie du bureau I-ICT.232 Business Support Solutions. Ce bureau gère des projets transversaux et met à disposition des solutions numériques pour les différents départements d'Infrabel, comme le développement d'applications, de plateformes et de portails.

Pour ce poste, tu seras souvent en contact avec le département Customer & Business Excellence (I-CBE), où toutes les tâches opérationnelles et liées aux clients de notre entreprise sont gérées.

La collaboration entre I-ICT.232 et I-CBE garantit que les solutions numériques et les architectures développées répondent parfaitement aux besoins opérationnels et liés aux clients d'Infrabel.

Nous recherchons un Data Analyst/Steward qui accumule des connaissances sur les données de la direction I-CBE. Tu décriras les données, les expliqueras et réaliseras toi-même des analyses afin de générer des résultats à valeur ajoutée.

Tâches Et Responsabilités


Décrire et présenter les données de manière compréhensible et exploitable.
Collecter et structurer des données brutes provenant de sources diverses, en tenant compte de la méthodologie et des normes établies par Infrabel, afin d'obtenir un extrait logique des données utiles et de créer la base d'analyses ultérieures.
Vérifier la qualité des données, détecter d'éventuelles irrégularités et discuter des erreurs avec le propriétaire des données afin de pouvoir effectuer des analyses sur des données de haute qualité.
Examiner et cartographier les différentes relations, liens et tendances existants dans les données afin d'obtenir une réponse à une demande précise.
Vérifier l'importance et la fiabilité des relations et des liens trouvés afin d'obtenir un résultat qui reflète la réalité.
Développer des modèles de données innovants basés sur les relations significatives trouvées afin d'optimiser les méthodes d'analyse existantes.
Établir des rapports, des tableaux de bord et des visualisations pour mettre en évidence les informations trouvées.
Fournir des interprétations des résultats obtenus afin de garantir l'exactitude des conclusions et de faciliter la prise de décisions associées .
Documenter les données dans le catalogue de données afin de garantir la disponibilité, l'utilisabilité et la centralisation des données.
Servir de point de contact pour toutes les questions concernant les données et partager les connaissances sur ces données au sein de I-ICT et de I-CBE.


TON PROFIL


Tu as un niveau master ou équivalent par expérience.
Expérience démontrable en données (au moins 3 ans) dans un poste similaire au sein du secteur ICT.
Excellentes compétences analytiques et travail précis et orienté vers les procédures.
Capacité à travailler de manière autonome dans des cadres convenus et être également un bon team player.
Communiquer de manière claire et structurée, adaptée à l'interlocuteur.
Penser de manière innovante et hors des sentiers battus.
Apprendre continuellement et suivre les évolutions technologiques.
Résistant au stress et capable de définir les bonnes priorités.
Connaissance des plateformes IT telles que les serveurs, les bases de données, les middleware et le cloud.
Connaissance statistique des algorithmes et des modèles mathématiques.
Connaissance de base du fonctionnement des technologies de données concernées.
Expérience avec la méthodologie de modélisation et la modélisation de processus (ERD/UML & BPMN).
Connaissance du fonctionnement d'Infrabel et de la SNCB est un plus.
S’exprimer couramment en français ou néerlandais, avec une bonne connaissance de l'autre langue nationale ou volonté de l'améliorer. Bonne connaissance de l'anglais technique.


Nous considérons la diversité comme une vraie richesse. Pour travailler chez nous, seuls le talent et l’enthousiasme entrent en ligne de compte.

NOTRE OFFRE


Un job passionnant et varié
Dans une entreprise stable qui contribue à une mobilité durable en phase avec la société
De nombreuses possibilités de formation et de carrière : tu es entrepreneur.neuse de ta propre carrière
Une grande flexibilité, pour un équilibre entre travail et vie privée
Un package salarial attrayant avec divers avantages supplémentaires
Tu voyages gratuitement en train


L'ENVIRONNEMENT DE TRAVAIL

Infrabel construit, entretient et renouvelle l’infrastructure ferroviaire en Belgique. Ensemble avec nos 10 000 collègues, nous voulons innover et créer de l'impact avec bienveillance, fiabilité, positivité et courage. Ces valeurs fondamentales sont la base de notre culture d'entreprise et guident tout ce que nous faisons. En misant sur les datas, la digitalisation et des partenariats solides, nous construisons une mobilité durable et sûre, maintenant et pour le futur.

Curieux.se d'en savoir plus ? Clique ici pour plus d'infos.

Chez Infrabel, nous sommes fier.e.s de notre certification Top Employer ! Car elle récompense nos nombreux projets en lien avec la sécurité et le bien-être de nos collègues, ou encore, notre ambitieuse politique de diversité et d'inclusion. Le télétravail, le développement personnel, l'ergonomie, la motivation du personnel, et la gestion du stress, ne sont que quelques exemples de thématiques sur lesquelles nous travaillons chaque jour.

QUELLES SERONT LES ETAPES ?

Postule en ligne > CV screening > Nous prenons contact avec toi > Entretien de recrutement > Bienvenue chez Infrabel!

Tu es en situation de handicap et tu as besoin d’ajustements raisonnables pour ton entretien d’embauche ? N'hésite pas à nous le faire savoir.

DES QUESTIONS SUR CETTE OFFRE D'EMPLOI?

Laura-Maria Mahr, Talent Acquisition Specialist | E-mail: lauramaria.mahr@infrabel.be

N’oublie pas de créer un profil via ‘Mon profil’. Tu peux non seulement ajouter tes données, mais également créer des « alertes d’emploi » en fonction de tes intérêts. De cette façon, tu seras le/la premier.ère à recevoir les nouvelles offre d’emploi qui te conviennent dans ta boîte mail.

  • Penser de manière innovante et hors des sentiers battus.
  • Apprendre continuellement et suivre les évolutions technologiques.
  • Résistant au stress et capable de définir les bonnes priorités.
  • Connaissance des plateformes IT telles que les serveurs, les bases de données, les middleware et le cloud.
  • Connaissance statistique des algorithmes et des modèles mathématiques.
  • Connaissance de base du fonctionnement des technologies de données concernées.
  • Expérience avec la méthodologie de modélisation et la modélisation de processus (ERD/UML & BPMN).
  • Connaissance du fonctionnement d'Infrabel et de la SNCB est un plus.
  • S’exprimer couramment en français ou néerlandais, avec une bonne connaissance de l'autre langue nationale ou volonté de l'améliorer. Bonne connaissance de l'anglais technique.

Nous considérons la diversité comme une vraie richesse. Pour travailler chez nous, seuls le talent et l’enthousiasme entrent en ligne de compte.

NOTRE OFFRE

  • Un job passionnant et varié
  • Dans une entreprise stable qui contribue à une mobilité durable en phase avec la société
  • De nombreuses possibilités de formation et de carrière : tu es entrepreneur.neuse de ta propre carrière
  • Une grande flexibilité, pour un équilibre entre travail et vie privée
  • Un package salarial attrayant avec divers avantages supplémentaires
  • Tu voyages gratuitement en train

L'ENVIRONNEMENT DE TRAVAIL

Infrabel construit, entretient et renouvelle l’infrastructure ferroviaire en Belgique. Ensemble avec nos 10 000 collègues, nous voulons innover et créer de l'impact avec bienveillance, fiabilité, positivité et courage. Ces valeurs fondamentales sont la base de notre culture d'entreprise et guident tout ce que nous faisons. En misant sur les datas, la digitalisation et des partenariats solides, nous construisons une mobilité durable et sûre, maintenant et pour le futur.

Curieux.se d'en savoir plus ? Clique ici pour plus d'infos.

Chez Infrabel, nous sommes fier.e.s de notre certification Top Employer ! Car elle récompense nos nombreux projets en lien avec la sécurité et le bien-être de nos collègues, ou encore, notre ambitieuse politique de diversité et d'inclusion. Le télétravail, le développement personnel, l'ergonomie, la motivation du personnel, et la gestion du stress, ne sont que quelques exemples de thématiques sur lesquelles nous travaillons chaque jour.

QUELLES SERONT LES ETAPES ?

Postule en ligne > CV screening > Nous prenons contact avec toi > Entretien de recrutement > Bienvenue chez Infrabel!

Tu es en situation de handicap et tu as besoin d’ajustements raisonnables pour ton entretien d’embauche ? N'hésite pas à nous le faire savoir.

DES QUESTIONS SUR CETTE OFFRE D'EMPLOI?

Laura-Maria Mahr, Talent Acquisition Specialist | E-mail: lauramaria.mahr@infrabel.be

N’oublie pas de créer un profil via ‘Mon profil’. Tu peux non seulement ajouter tes données, mais également créer des « alertes d’emploi » en fonction de tes intérêts. De cette façon, tu seras le/la premier.ère à recevoir les nouvelles offre d’emploi qui te conviennent dans ta boîte mail.

Title: Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 3 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Data analyst EMEA
Description:
Aliaxis EMEA is seeking a data analyst to oversee all data requirements for the implementation of an Advanced Planning System for our supply chain division across 7 regions in EMEA. Reporting to the Business Process Manager for Digital & Data, the Data analyst ensures data accuracy, consistency, and integrity throughout the project. This role involves extensive collaboration with business and IT stakeholders, acting as the go-to expert for coordinating with local data owners and managers.

We are offering a unique 2-year opportunity to be part of this transformative journey and contribute to high-impact projects. The role is based in Aliaxis EMEA Head-office, Brussels and will require up to 15% of travelling across the region.

Company Description

Aliaxis exists to bring solutions to the world's water challenges and accelerate the transition to clean energy. We are a global leader in high-quality fluid management solutions for use in building, infrastructure, industrial and agricultural applications across the globe. Over 15,000 people have selected to work for us in more than 40 countries.

We Are Looking For Passionate People That Want To Be Part Of Our Journey And Embrace The Behaviors That We At Aliaxis Stand For

We Dare to challenge the status quo, to innovate and to learn fast,

We Care for the environment, our customers and each other,

We Deliver by taking accountability for our decisions and actions.

Aliaxis is privately owned, with its global & EMEA headquarters in Brussels, Belgium.

Key Accountabilities


Data Management
Stakeholder collaboration
Data collection & cleansing
Data integration
Data validation & testing
Training & support


Responsibilities


Develop and implement data management strategies to support the APS implementation. Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across all regions. Coordinate data collection, cleansing, and validation activities
Work closely with business and IT stakeholders to understand data requirements and ensure alignment with project goals. Facilitate regular meetings to discuss data-related issues and progress. Act as the primary point of contact for local data owners and managers.
Collaborate with local data owners to gather necessary data from various sources. Perform data cleansing to ensure accuracy and consistency. Validate data to ensure it meets the requirements for APS.
Work with IT teams to integrate data from different systems into APS. Ensure seamless data flow between APS and other business systems.
Conduct data validation checks to ensure data integrity. Participate in system testing to verify data is correctly processed and utilized by APS
Develop training materials and conduct training sessions for local data owners and users. Provide ongoing support to ensure data-related issues are promptly addressed.


Requirements


Experience and related skillset in data management preferably in Supply Chain or Operations; understanding of key Supply Chain concepts
Good understanding of Demand and Supply Planning processes and Advanced Planning Systems
Working knowledge of ERP systems
Experience in managing business and IT stakeholders
Fluent in English – any additional European language is a plus


We offer a unique opportunity to join a European (Belgian) global company with a very international & collaborative culture that is transforming dynamically and that is committed to its future growth, service excellence and employee engagement. Next to a competitive salary and benefits package, we offer an impactful role and real growth opportunities.

Aliaxis is proud to be an equal opportunity employer who welcomes candidates and employees from all backgrounds. We are committed to building and investing in a culture of belonging, where all our employees feel empowered, can be their true selves and are able to bring their best ideas forward and contribute to the company’s “Growth with Purpose” strategy.

For us, equity and belonging start already at the application step: whether it's offering flexibility in scheduling interviews, or ensuring a supportive and inclusive environment, we strive to remove barriers and create equal opportunities for all applicants. Should you have specific needs, please do not hesitate to let us know and we will do our best to accommodate.

Please copy link to browser to access Aliaxis Privacy Notice: https://aliaxis.com/recruitment-privacy-notice/

Note to agencies: Please kindly abstain from sending us candidates either directly to HR or to one of your contacts within the company. Thanks!

Title: Analyst
Description:
Description: You will be responsible for documenting, monitoring and continuously improving the Field Service Management process for customer field force.




You will be interacting with local field and dispatching teams as well as project teams to understand and document the current as-is processes, business rules and function allocation diagrams of the appointment, capacity and work-management business capabilities. You will mainly use Office tools (Word, Visio, Excel) to document while in draft and once matured the information is shared with a broader audience of process experts and architects.




Apart from assuring the documentation, you will work on improving the consumption of this knowledge by helping to build a Knowledge HUB and leveraging AI based solution such as O365 CoPilot.

Finally, you will be identifying key metrics that allow us to measure how the process is performing, crunching data and identifying improvement possibilities.




You will be working in a multiskilled team of experts and with a sharing mentality and are not afraid to step out of your comfort zone.




Required Responsibilities

- Acquire a thorough understanding of the business processes and rules.

- Documenting processes , functional allocation diagrams

- Capturing requirements and documenting them as user-stories

- Identify key performance indicators

- Crunching data to validate processes and gather insights

- Identify pain-points and future improvements

- Pitch improvement projects to domain stakeholders and senior management

- Share knowledge with the team and provide council to project teams

- Help to improve the consumption of knowledge




Technical Skills

- Business Process discovery and analysis

- BPMN

- Visio

- O365 tools

- Data analysis and statistics

- AI tools such as CoPilot and ML algorithms is a plus

- Experience in Field Service Management is a plus




Attitudes/behaviour

- Communicator

- Team player

- Analytical approach

- Pragmatic

- Assertive when required

- Presentation skills

- Time and backlog management




Languages

- Fluent English

- Dutch or French is necessary

- Working in a multilingual environment (EN, NL, FR) on site in Belgium 2 days per week.

Title: Data Analyst(SAN817)
Description:
Job Description

Welcome to Sansaone, a dynamic force in the realm of ICT talent acquisition. Born out of a passion for excellence and a vision for connecting outstanding professionals with forward-thinking organizations, we stand as a beacon for strategic recruitment solutions in the Information and Communication Technology sector. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for connecting exceptional professionals with innovative organizations, we are your strategic partner in building transformative teams.


A Data Analyst is responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing ongoing reports to help organizations make data-driven decisions.
This role involves gathering, processing, and performing statistical analysis on large datasets to extract insights, support business objectives, and enhance operational efficiency. Responsibilities:
Gather data from various internal and external sources.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Work closely with business units to understand their data needs and deliver insights accordingly.
Develop and implement procedures for data collection and storage.
Identify business issues and provide data-driven solutions. Technical Skills:
Microsoft Excel
Tableau
Power BI
QlikView
Python
MySQL
PostgreSQL


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator


LinkedIn
Mail

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !
Show more
HTML:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative analyst

About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise :


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 40 quantitative analysts. It’s mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS. The quantitative analyst will be part of the “Power & Emissions” quant team (approximately 10 people) and will be supporting the different local business platforms, with a focus on the US Business Platform located in Houston. Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:


Work very closely with the BP US, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading teams. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, …).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.


Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, …)
Experience on different optimization methods
Strong coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Experience in a trading environment
Familiar with Git




Good to have:

Experience on the power markets

Soft skills:


Must have:

Practical and conceptual thinking
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Ability to deliver concrete solutions
Autonomy
Working together

Education and professional background:


Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
3 to 15 years of experience in a similar role.


Languages:


English


Travels: Regular travels to the US (Houston) are needed

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING

Legal Entity: ENGIE GLOBAL MARKETS, BELGIAN BRANCH

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Master's Degree

Title: Solver - Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.




At Exsolvæ, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.




Your Role:

As a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.




Preferred Skills

Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.




Technical Implementation

Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.




Project Management

Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we’d love to hear from you!
